Articles.Content:
Hi everyone,

I'm a chemistry student with a passion for all things space-related. I'm from The Netherlands, but I currently reside in Michigan, where I'm doing an internship before finishing my studies. 

I have been playing KSP for about a year now, and I've visited this forum on-and-off until I decided it was time to get a bit more active! I've been flying around to some of the more obvious targets (Eve, Duna, Jool) in Science Mode, but a while ago it seemed like a good idea to start a Career Mode game to spice things up. I'm now totally caught up in the process of building a viable SSTO for a visit to Laythe, which so far has had mixed results.

That's about it, I'll see you around on the forum I guess!

Welcome to the forums Woksaus! Enjoy your stay, its a nice place ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Cant wait to see your SSTO spaceplanes, as i am building such things primarily at the moment.

Be seeing you in orbit.

I'm glad you decided to become a bit more active on the forum. I spend quite a bit of time building SSTO planes too (though maybe not so much recently). Hope to see some of your designs at some point.

Welcome to the forums! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Cheers,

~Claw

You're from the Netherlands? 

Any chance you could tell me about TU Delft?

Also, welcome aboard!

> 
> You're from the Netherlands? 
> Any chance you could tell me about TU Delft?
> 
> Also, welcome aboard!

Yeah, I am. I'm from Utrecht University though. Why, what would you like to know?
Thanks for the warm welcome! As soon as I'll have some viable design, I'll make sure to post it. I've been messing around with other people's designs, but I'd rather come up with my own interplanetary-worthy creation.
